snippet: Brady appealed his suspension for using deflated footballs during the A.F.C. championship game, and Commissioner Roger Goodell said he would hear the appeal.
abstract: New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady formally appeals his four-game suspension for his role in deflated footballs scandal; NFL commissioner Roger Goodell says he will hear appeal.
lead_paragraph: Brady appealed his suspension for using deflated footballs during the A.F.C. championship game, and Commissioner Roger Goodell said he would hear the appeal.

headline.main: Goodell Says He Will Hear Brady Appeal
